title: Ah Whither Shall I Go

author.name: Charles Wesley
author.bio: Charles Wesley was an English leader of the Methodist movement, and the author of over 6,000 hymns. His hymns are notable for their lyrical quality and deep theological reflection.

lyrics:
Ah whither shall I go
Burdened and sick and faint?
To whom should I my troubles show
And pour out my complaint?

My Saviour bids me come
Ah why do I delay?
He calls the weary sinner home
And yet from Him I stray

What is it keeps me back
From which I cannot part
Which will not let my Saviour take
Possession of my heart?

Some cursed thing unknown
Must surely lurk within
Some idol which I will not own
Some secret bossom sin

Jesus the hindrance show
Which I have feared to see
Yet let me now consent to know
What keep me out of Thee

Searcher of heart in mine
Thy trying power display
Into its darkest hour shine
And take the veil away

I now believe in Thee
Compassion reigns alone
According to my faith to me
O let Lord be done.
